EXHIBIT A. Statement of Rates
OPERATING STATEMENT
SECTION 1. Introductory Statement
This Operating Statement describes how Louisville Gas and Electric Company ("LG&E"), a combination electric utility and natural gas distribution company operating within the Commonwealth of Kentucky, shall provide firm and interruptible natural gas Storage Services, as well as firm Local Gas Transportation Service, in interstate commerce pursuant to Section 284.224 of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission's regulations, 18 C.F.R. ? 284.224. LG&E reserves the right not to offer or commence such natural gas Storage Service or Local Gas Transportation Service or to discontinue any interruptible natural gas Storage Service when, in LG&E's sole judgment, any impairment of its firm services, including its ability to operate LG&E's natural gas storage or other facilities to support firm services and gas purchases for firm services, would or may result. LG&E also reserves the right to file to modify this Operating Statement as it deems necessary and appropriate from time to time.
SECTION 2. Definitions
2.1 "Agreement" means the applicable Firm Local Gas Transportation Agreement or Storage Service Agreement, or the Interruptible Interstate Storage Service Agreement (including all Exhibits), between LG&E and a Customer, as such may be amended and supplemented from time to time. All references to "interstate storage services" refer only to storage and related transportation on LG&E's distribution system involving further transportation of Gas in interstate commerce. All references to "interstate transportation services" refer only to the transportation on LG&E's distribution system involving transportation of Gas that will be further transported and/or consumed outside the Commonwealth of Kentucky.
2.2 "Authorized Overrun Quantities" means a quantity of Gas in excess of Customer's Maximum Daily Injection Quantity or Maximum Daily Withdrawal Quantity which LG&E agrees, in its sole judgment, to inject or withdraw for Customer on any Day, pursuant to Section 7.
2.3 "Base Gas" means the Gas required in Storage necessary to provide the pressure to cycle the Working Gas in Storage, as set forth in the applicable Service Agreement.
2.4 "Business Day" means any day other than a Saturday, Sunday, or a day on which commercial banks are closed in the Commonwealth of Kentucky.
2.5 "Customer" means any eligible person or entity that contracts for any Storage Service or Local Gas Transportation Service offered by LG&E pursuant to this Operating Statement, the applicable Service Agreement, and the limited jurisdiction certificate issued by FERC to LG&E under 18 C.F.R. ? 284.224, as each of the same may be modified or supplemented from time to time.
2.6 "Day" means the period of time corresponding to the gas day as observed by LG&E.
2.7 "Dth" means a unit of heating value equal to 10 therms or one million Btus (1 MMBtu).
2.8 "FERC" means the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission or its successor agency.
2.9 "Force Majeure" has the meaning specified in Section 13.
2.10 "Gas" means natural gas, including renewable natural gas derived from landfill gas, or other bio-gas, synthetic gas, or locally produced natural gas, of a quality at least equal to the quality specified in Section 9.
2.11 "Gas Line Tracker Charge" means the surcharge LG&E applies to Customers utilizing Local Gas Transportation Service in order for LG&E to recover gas pipeline facility removal and replacement costs, as approved by the Kentucky Public Service Commission for comparable intrastate service and provided in Exhibit A to this Operating Statement.
2.12 "Gross Nominated Volume" means Customer's nominated volume of Gas, in Mcf, to be received by LG&E at the Transportation Receipt Point.
2.13 "Imbalance" or "Imbalances" has the meaning specified in Section 6.3.1.1.
2.14 "Interconnect Facility Agreement" has the meaning specified in Section 4.1.7.
2.15 "LAUFG" means lost and unaccounted for natural gas expressed as a percentage and provided in Exhibit A to this Operating Statement, as approved by the Kentucky Public Service Commission for use in LG&E's state tariff for local gas delivery service.
2.16 "LG&E Force Majeure Event" has the meaning specified in Section 13.
2.17 "Local Gas Flow Order" or "LGFO" means an issuance made by LG&E in accordance with Section 12 that will require actions by Local Gas Transportation Service Customer(s) to alleviate conditions that, in the sole judgment of LG&E, jeopardize the operational integrity of LG&E's system.
2.18 "Local Gas Transportation Service" means interstate transportation of Gas produced in the Commonwealth of Kentucky and transported by LG&E on its distribution system pursuant to a FERC certificate issued under 18 C.F.R. ? 284.224, and performed for a Customer in accordance with the terms of this Operating Statement and a Local Gas Transportation Service Agreement with such Customer. The term "Local Gas Transportation Service" as used herein shall not include any services offered by LG&E pursuant to the tariffs approved by the Kentucky Public Service Commission.
2.19 "Maximum Daily Quantity" or "MDQ" means the maximum quantity of Gas, specified in the Local Gas Transportation Service Agreement, that Customer may schedule for LG&E to transport and deliver at the designated Transportation Delivery Point on any Day.
2.20 "Maximum Daily Injection Quantity" or "MDIQ" means the maximum quantity of Gas, specified in the Storage Service Agreement, that Customer is entitled to inject into Storage on any Day.
2.21 "Maximum Daily Withdrawal Quantity" or "MDWQ" means the maximum quantity of Gas, specified in the Storage Service Agreement, that Customer is entitled to withdraw from Storage on any Day.
2.22 "Maximum Daily Gas Index" means the higher of the following: either (a) the highest daily mid-point price posted in Platts Gas Daily for Texas Gas Zone 1 adjusted for Fuel Retention applicable to deliveries to Zone 4 under Texas Gas Transmission, LLC's Rate Schedule NNS plus the Commodity Charge and any surcharges applicable to deliveries to Zone 4 under Texas Gas Transmission, LLC's Rate Schedule NNS during the month in which the imbalance occurred, or (b) the highest daily mid-point price posted in Platts Gas Daily for Lebanon-Hub adjusted for fuel retention applicable to deliveries to Zone 4 under Texas Gas Transmission, LLC's Rate Schedule NNS plus the Commodity Charge and any surcharges applicable to deliveries to Zone 4 under Texas Gas Transmission, LLC's Rate Schedule NNS. If Platts Gas Daily or any pricing point specified herein is no longer available, LG&E will, as a substitute, use equivalent prices from a recognized natural gas industry publication.
2.23 "Maximum Storage Capacity" or "MSC" means the maximum quantity of Gas that Customer is entitled to maintain in Storage at any given time.
2.24 "Metered Receipts" means the metered volume of Gas in Mcf received by LG&E from Customer at the Transportation Receipt Point.
2.25 "Minimum Daily Gas Index" means the lower of the following: either (a) the lowest daily mid-point price posted in Platts Gas Daily for Texas Gas Zone 1 adjusted for Fuel Retention applicable to deliveries to Zone 4 under Texas Gas Transmission, LLC's Rate Schedule NNS plus the Commodity Charge and any surcharges applicable to deliveries to Zone 4 under Texas Gas Transmission, LLC's Rate Schedule NNS during the month in which the imbalance occurred, or (b) the lowest daily mid-point price posted in Platts Gas Daily for Lebanon-Hub adjusted for fuel retention applicable to deliveries to Zone 4 under Texas Gas Transmission, LLC's Rate Schedule NNS plus the Commodity Charge and any surcharges applicable to deliveries to Zone 4 under Texas Gas Transmission, LLC's Rate Schedule NNS. If Platts Gas Daily or any pricing point specified herein is no longer available, LG&E will, as a substitute, use equivalent prices from a recognized natural gas industry publication.
2.26 "Monthly Billing Demand" means the greater of (1) the Maximum Daily Quantity, or (2) the highest daily volume of Gas delivered to the Customer's designated Transportation Delivery Point during the current month or the previous eleven (11) monthly billing periods.
2.27 "Party" means LG&E or Customer.
2.28 "Retention Gas" means the amount of Customer's Gas tendered for injection which is retained by LG&E as reimbursement for compressor fuel and other losses incurred in the provision of Storage service, as set forth in the Storage Service Agreement.
2.29 "Service Agreement" or "Agreement" means the Firm Interstate Storage Service Agreement or Firm Interstate Local Gas Transportation Service Agreement or Interruptible Storage Service Agreement, as the case may be, between LG&E and Customer, as such Agreement may be modified from time to time.
2.30 "Storage" means the various underground natural gas storage facilities interconnected with LG&E's natural gas distribution system which LG&E owns or controls from time to time.
2.31 "Storage Account" means, for accounting purposes, the account maintained by LG&E into which Customer nominates Gas for injection into Storage or from which Customer nominates Gas for withdrawal from Storage under a Service Agreement. The Storage Account may not have a negative balance.
2.32 "Storage Delivery Point" means the point, as specified in the Storage Service Agreement, where LG&E's distribution system interconnects with Texas Gas Transmission, LLC.
2.33 "Storage Receipt Point(s)" means the point, as specified in the Storage Service Agreement, where LG&E's distribution system interconnects with Texas Gas Transmission, LLC.
2.34 "Storage Service" means interstate Gas storage services and related transportation services on LG&E's distribution system provided to Customer by LG&E pursuant to a FERC certificate issued under 18 C.F.R. ? 284.224, performed in accordance with the terms of this Operating Statement and a Service Agreement with such Customer. The term "Storage Service" as used herein shall not include any services offered by LG&E pursuant to the tariffs approved by the Public Service Commission of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.
2.35 "Transportation Delivery Point" means the point, as specified in the Local Gas Transportation Service Agreement, where LG&E's distribution system interconnects with Texas Gas Transmission, LLC.
2.36 "Transportation Receipt Point" means the point, as specified in the Local Gas Transportation Service Agreement, at which Customer shall provide Gas to LG&E for Local Gas Transportation Service.
2.37 "Transporter" means any upstream or downstream pipeline that provides services required to effectuate delivery or redelivery of Gas to or from LG&E's system.
2.38 "Working Gas" means the actual quantity of Gas in Storage for Customer's account at the beginning of any given Day that is not Base Gas.
2.39 Additional terms indicated by capitalization and utilized in this Operating Statement shall have the meaning ascribed to them where first utilized.
SECTION 3. Interstate Storage Services
3.1 Types of Service
3.1.1 Firm Storage Service. From time to time, subject to LG&E having available capacity in storage, Customer meeting the eligibility requirements set forth herein, and the execution of a Service Agreement setting forth an agreed upon rate and other essential terms, LG&E will offer firm Storage Services (which includes interstate natural Gas storage and related transportation services on LG&E's distribution system) to Customers on a non-discriminatory basis. An Agreement for firm Storage Service shall be for a term of at least one (1) year, and not more than five (5) years. LG&E shall have the right to curtail or interrupt Firm Storage Service hereunder when, in LG&E's judgment, such curtailment is necessary to enable LG&E to respond to an emergency or Force Majeure condition. With the exception of emergency or Force Majeure conditions, Firm Storage Service will not be subject to curtailment, interruption, or discontinuance except as provided herein or in the Service Agreement.
3.1.2 Interruptible Storage Service. From time to time, subject to LG&E having available capacity in storage, Customer meeting the eligibility requirements set forth herein, and the execution of a Service Agreement setting forth an agreed upon rate and other essential terms, LG&E will offer interruptible Storage Services (which includes interstate natural Gas storage and related transportation services on LG&E's distribution system) to Customers on a non-discriminatory basis. Such service will be subject to curtailment, interruption, and discontinuance as provided for herein or in the Service Agreement. Customers or potential Customers may request such interruptible service at any time; however, LG&E shall have no obligation to perform said service as an initial matter.
3.2 Requests for Storage Service
3.2.1 Request for Service. A potential Customer desiring Storage Service under this Operating Statement shall make a written request to LG&E which includes information such as, but not limited to, the exact legal name of the potential Customer requesting Storage Service, the type of Storage Service that is requested, the proposed Maximum Daily Injection/Withdrawal Quantities, proposed term of service, and other proposed terms and conditions, if any.
3.2.2 Response to Request for Service. LG&E shall consider the Storage Service request and contact the potential Customer regarding whether it can provide such service and, if so, will provide the details (including, rate, quantity, and other essential terms) according to which LG&E is willing to provide such service. If LG&E can provide some, but not all, of the requested Storage Service, LG&E will advise the potential Customer of the maximum quantities that LG&E would be able to accommodate. A Storage Service request shall not be valid and LG&E shall not be required to provide any such service if: (i) LG&E determines, based on a credit analysis, that the potential Customer does not have credit sufficient to LG&E's satisfaction as described in Section 5 below; (ii) the service requested would require the construction, modification, expansion or acquisition of any facilities; (iii) the service requested would not comply with this Operating Statement; (iv) LG&E lacks adequate injection/withdrawal or transportation capacity to provide the requested service; or (v) the potential Customer and LG&E are unable to agree upon mutually acceptable rates for such service.
3.2.3 Tender of Service Agreement. When the potential Customer and LG&E have agreed upon the essential terms regarding a request for Storage Service, LG&E shall tender a Service Agreement to the potential Customer reflecting such agreed upon terms. The Service Agreement shall be invalid unless signed by the potential Customer and returned to LG&E within thirty (30) Days after LG&E tenders such Service Agreement for execution.
SECTION 4. Interstate Local Gas Transportation Services
4.1 Type of Service From time to time, subject to LG&E having available capacity and Customer meeting the eligibility requirements set forth herein (including its execution of a Local Gas Transportation Service Agreement), LG&E will offer firm Local Gas Transportation Service to Customers on a non-discriminatory basis. LG&E will only offer Local Gas Transportation Service to Customers where and when such transportation will not, in the sole judgment of LG&E, interfere with the operation of LG&E's storage or other facilities, or the delivery of Gas to LG&E's retail sales or end-use Gas transportation customers. In doing so, LG&E will offer to receive Customer's Gas at a designated Transportation Receipt Point and transport such Gas through LG&E's distribution system, in order to deliver equivalent quantities of such Gas at a designated Transportation Delivery Point. An Agreement for Local Gas Transportation Service shall be for a minimum initial term of one (1) year or through the following October 31, whichever period is shorter. LG&E, in its sole judgment, may require that a Local Gas Transportation Service Agreement be executed for a longer initial term when deemed necessary by the size of the MDQ or other special circumstances. After such initial term, Local Gas Transportation Service shall automatically continue in full force and effect from year to year (from November 1 through October 31, which period shall be defined as a "Contract Year"), until terminated by either Party hereto for any reason, or no reason, pursuant to written notice of termination given by one Party to the other Party by the April 30th prior to the next available November 1st termination date.
4.1.1 Local Gas Transportation Service under this Operating Statement shall be considered firm from the Transportation Receipt Point to the Transportation Delivery Point. LG&E shall have the right to curtail or interrupt Local Gas Transportation Service hereunder when, in LG&E's judgment, such curtailment is necessary to enable LG&E to respond to an emergency or Force Majeure condition. With the exception of emergency or Force Majeure conditions, Local Gas Transportation Service will not be subject to curtailment, interruption, or discontinuance except as provided herein or in the Local Gas Transportation Service Agreement. LG&E shall receive Gas from Customer for transportation at the Transportation Receipt Point and deliver such Gas, including by displacement, to the Transportation Delivery Point. LG&E's sole obligation hereunder is to redeliver Customer's Gas from the Transportation Receipt Point to the Transportation Delivery Point. Accordingly, LG&E has no obligation to deliver a volume of Gas to the Transportation Delivery Point, either daily or monthly, which differs from the volume of Gas delivered to LG&E at the Transportation Receipt Point. LG&E will provide service to meet imbalances only on an as-available basis, as set forth herein.
4.1.2 LG&E shall not be obligated to deliver Gas to the Transportation Delivery Point in excess of the MDQ as further defined herein. Customer and LG&E shall mutually agree to establish the level of the MDQ; provided, however, that the MDQ shall not be less than 50 Mcf/day.
4.1.3 LG&E may decline to deliver volumes to the Transportation Delivery Point in excess of the MDQ or accept volumes from the Transportation Receipt Point that are in excess of the MDQ plus applicable LAUFG.
4.1.4 LG&E may deliver volumes of Gas to the Transportation Delivery Point in excess of the MDQ; provided, however, that such deliveries to the Transportation Delivery Point in excess of the MDQ shall establish a new Monthly Billing Demand as further defined herein. Regardless of the Monthly Billing Demand established by Customer, LG&E's obligation to provide Local Gas Transportation Service shall be limited to the MDQ.
4.1.5 Volumes shall be delivered by Customer to LG&E at the Transportation Receipt Point as nearly as practicable at uniform hourly rates of flow, that is, 1/24th of the daily Gross Nominated Volume as further defined herein. Should Customers be unable to provide an amount of Gas to LG&E at the Transportation Receipt Point equivalent to the Gross Nominated Volume, LG&E will not be obligated hereunder to provide standby quantities of Gas. Furthermore, LG&E will not be obligated to utilize any of its underground storage capacity for purposes of Local Gas Transportation Service.
4.1.6 LG&E shall not be required to install any facilities of any kind to provide Local Gas Transportation Service to any Customer under this Operating Statement. In the event that LG&E is agreeable to the installation or alteration of any facilities as may be required to serve Customer, then Customer shall execute a separate agreement for the construction of such facilities and shall pay for all costs of those facilities prior to LG&E commencing construction of those facilities. LG&E shall not be obligated to extend the pipeline mains on LG&E's distribution system to facilitate Local Gas Transportation Service hereunder.
4.1.7 LG&E and Customer shall enter into an agreement covering the design, ownership, operation, and maintenance of any applicable interconnection facilities, including, but not limited to, any cost reimbursement provisions ("Interconnect Facility Agreement"). LG&E shall own and operate the interconnection facilities (including, but not limited to, regulation, meters, chromatograph, control valves, taps, insulators, rights-of-way, and related facilities) as are required to effectuate Local Gas Transportation Service under the Operating Statement.
4.2 Requests for Local Gas Transportation Service
4.2.1 Request for Service. A potential Customer desiring Local Gas Transportation Service under this Operating Statement shall make a written request to LG&E which includes information such as, but not limited to, the exact legal name of the potential Customer, the proposed Maximum Daily Quantity, the designated Transportation Receipt and Delivery Points, the proposed term of service, and other proposed terms and conditions, if any.
4.2.2 Response to Request for Service. LG&E shall consider the Local Gas Transportation Service request and contact the potential Customer regarding whether it can provide such service and, if so, shall provide the details (including, rate, quantity, and other essential terms) according to which LG&E is willing to provide such service. If LG&E can provide some, but not all, of the requested Local Gas Transportation Service, LG&E will advise the potential Customer of the maximum quantities that LG&E is able to accommodate. A Local Gas Transportation Service request shall not be valid and LG&E shall not be required to provide any such service if: (i) LG&E determines, based on a credit analysis, that the potential Customer does not have sufficient credit as described in Section 5 below; (ii) the service requested would require the construction, modification, expansion, or acquisition of any facilities; (iii) the service requested would not comply with this Operating Statement; (iv) LG&E lacks adequate transportation capacity to provide the requested service; or (v) the potential Customer and LG&E are unable to agree upon mutually acceptable terms for such service.
4.2.3 Tender of Service Agreement. When LG&E and the potential Customer have agreed upon the essential terms regarding a request for Local Gas Transportation Service, LG&E shall tender a Service Agreement to the potential Customer reflecting such agreed upon terms. The Service Agreement shall be invalid unless signed by the potential Customer and returned to LG&E within thirty (30) Days after LG&E tenders such Service Agreement for execution.
SECTION 5. Creditworthiness
5.1 Eligibility As a condition of eligibility for Storage or Local Gas Transportation Service, a potential Customer shall be required to establish, to LG&E's satisfaction, and shall be required to provide proof of its creditworthiness. LG&E shall be entitled to undertake such credit searches as it deems necessary and appropriate and to require that it receive sufficient information to establish that the potential Customer is creditworthy. The results of such creditworthiness checks will be communicated to the potential Customer within approximately two (2) weeks of receipt of the completed application. If the potential Customer is sufficiently creditworthy, no security shall be required.
5.1.1 LG&E shall not be required to commence service, or to continue to provide service under any Service Agreement with a Customer that: (1) when requested by LG&E to demonstrate creditworthiness, including for continuation of service in light of previous payment experience and changes thereto, fails to do so in LG&E's reasonable judgment; (2) is or has become insolvent; (3) makes an assignment or other general arrangement for the benefit of creditors; or (4) is unable to pay its debts as they become due.
5.1.2 All of LG&E's creditworthiness review standards and requirements shall be imposed on a non-discriminatory basis. Security shall no longer be required where LG&E deems that security is no longer needed or when the Customer is no longer receiving service from LG&E.
5.2. Failure of Storage Service Customer to Establish or Maintain Creditworthiness If a potential Storage Service Customer cannot establish that it is creditworthy, in accordance with the criteria below, the creditworthiness requirements of this section can nonetheless be satisfied by the posting of appropriate security acceptable to LG&E. The amount of security required shall be determined in LG&E's sole judgment, and shall be adequate to service the potential Customer's payment for the level of Storage Service(s) requested.
5.2.1 If as of the time it applies for Storage Service or at any time during the term of a Service Agreement, Customer's unsecured long-term senior indebtedness not supported by third party credit enhancement shall be or have fallen below either of the following ratings in any of the following indices, then Customer shall, at LG&E's election, be required to furnish satisfactory security:
INDEX RATING Standard and Poor's Corporation or its successor "Corporate and Municipal Ratings" BB+
Moody's Investors Service Inc., or its successor "Long-Term Debt Ratings" Ba1
5.2.2 If Customer does not have a debt rating in the previously described rating category, then the lesser of the Customer's Corporate/Issuers Rating, senior debt rating, or subordinated debt rating shall apply. Satisfactory security includes, but is not limited to, ensuring payment for purchases of a ninety (90) Day supply of Gas by (a) the posting of a bond; or (b) the provision of an irrevocable letter of credit from banks or financial institutions meeting at least one of the following minimum credit standards: (i) a Thompson Bank Watch rating of "B", (ii) an IBCA rating of "C", legal rating of two, or (iii) a long-term rating of "A" from Standard & Poor's; or (c) the provision of a guarantee of payment from another credit-worthy entity. The amount secured by such an instrument shall be an amount adequate to secure Customer's performance hereunder in LG&E's reasonable discretion. LG&E shall have the right to suspend its performance under any Service Agreement five (5) Days after giving notice of its demands for satisfactory security from Customer under this Section 5.2.2 without further notice until such time as it has received satisfactory security; and neither Party shall be liable to the other for a breach of a Service Agreement due to such suspension. If Customer fails to provide satisfactory security within thirty (30) Days after notice of LG&E's demand therefor, then LG&E shall have the right to terminate this Agreement immediately upon giving notice of termination.
5.3 Failure of Local Gas Transportation Service Customer to Establish or Maintain Creditworthiness If a potential Local Gas Transportation Service Customer cannot establish that it is creditworthy, the creditworthiness requirements of this section can nonetheless be satisfied by the posting of appropriate security acceptable to LG&E. The amount of security required shall be determined in LG&E's sole judgment, and shall be adequate to service the potential Customer's payment for the level of Local Gas Transportation Service(s) requested. Local Gas Transportation Service Customer shall, upon request of LG&E, agree to maintain an irrevocable letter of credit, cash prepayment, or such other financial instrument satisfactory to LG&E ("credit support") in order to assure Local Gas Transportation Service Customer's performance of its obligations hereunder.
5.3.1 In determining the level of the security to be required of a Local Gas Transportation Service Customer, LG&E shall consider factors including, but not limited to, the following: the volume of Gas to be transported on behalf of Local Gas Transportation Service Customer, the MDQ, the general creditworthiness of Local Gas Transportation Service Customer, and Local Gas Transportation Service Customer's prior credit record with LG&E, if any. The amount of the credit support shall not exceed two twelfths (2/12) of Local Gas Transportation Service Customer's estimated annual bill for Local Gas Transportation Service.
5.3.2 In the event that Local Gas Transportation Service Customer defaults on its obligations under this Operating Statement for Local Gas Transportation Service, LG&E shall have the immediate right to draw on such credit support to satisfy Local Gas Transportation Service Customer's obligation hereunder.
SECTION 6. Rates and Charges
6.1 Firm Storage Service Rates for firm Storage Services will be market-based, subject to negotiation and agreement between LG&E and the potential Customer and will be set forth in the Service Agreement between the Parties.
6.2 Interruptible Storage Service Rates for interruptible Storage Services will be market-based, subject to negotiation and agreement between LG&E and the potential Customer and will be set forth in the Service Agreement between the Parties.
6.3 Local Gas Transportation Service Rates for Local Gas Transportation Service, including the Administrative Charge, Basic Service Charge, Monthly Demand Charge, Transportation Charge, Local Gas Flow Order Charge, Gas Line Tracker Charge, and Utilization Charges for Daily Imbalances, are reflected in Exhibit A to this Operating Statement.
6.3.1 Additional Charges.
6.3.1.1 Imbalance Charge. The terms "Imbalance" or "Imbalances" as used herein mean the difference between Customer's Gross Nominated Volume in Mcf of Gas to be received at the Transportation Receipt Point and the metered volume of Gas in Mcf received by LG&E from Customer at the Transportation Receipt Point ("Metered Receipts"). When LG&E can provide such balancing service, the Utilization Charge for Daily Imbalances described below shall apply to daily imbalances in excess of +/-5% of the Gross Nominated Volume. LG&E shall issue a Local Gas Flow Order as set forth herein during periods when service cannot be provided to accommodate daily imbalances. LG&E shall calculate on a daily and monthly basis Customer's imbalance resulting from the difference between Customer's Gross Nominated Volume in Mcf for receipt by LG&E at the Transportation Receipt Point and the Metered Receipts of Gas in Mcf from Customer at the Transportation Receipt Point. This will be calculated as follows: Imbalance = Gross Nominated Volumes - Metered Receipts LG&E will also determine the imbalance percentage. This percentage will be calculated as follows: (Gross Nominated Volumes - Metered Receipts) Imbalance % = Gross Nominated Volumes
If the monthly Imbalance is negative (an over-delivery into LG&E's system), LG&E shall purchase the monthly Imbalance from Customer at a price per Mcf which is determined by multiplying the appropriate percentage specified below times the Minimum Daily Gas Index, as defined in 2.25. The appropriate percentage shall be dependent on the Customer's monthly imbalance percentage to be applied as follows:
When Total Net Negative Imbalance Percentage is: The following percentage shall be multiplied by the above-determined amount: 0% to < 5% 100% > 5% to < 10% 90% > 10% to < 15% 80% > 15% to < 20% 70% > 20% 60%
If the monthly Imbalance is positive (an under-delivery into LG&E's system), Customer shall purchase the monthly Imbalance from LG&E at a price per Mcf which is determined by multiplying the appropriate percentage specified below times the Maximum Daily Gas Index, as defined in Section 2.22. The appropriate percentage shall be dependent on the Customer's monthly imbalance percentage to be applied as follows:
When Total Net Positive Imbalance Percentage is: The following percentage shall be multiplied by the above-determined amount:
0% to < 5% 100% > 5% to < 10% 110% > 10% to < 15% 120% > 15% to < 20% 130% > 20% 140%
The monthly imbalance percentages stated above will be used to calculate the cash-out price for Imbalances that fall within each category. For example, a Customer with a monthly imbalance percentage of 9% will cash-out at the 0% to 5% price for 5% of the imbalance and at the 5% to 10% price for 4% of the imbalance. All such cash-out charges or credits, as applicable, shall be shown and included on Customer's monthly bill. The billing of these cash-out charges or credits shall not be construed as a waiver by LG&E of any other rights or remedies it has under FERC or other federal or state law, or this Operating Statement, nor shall it be construed as an exclusive remedy for failure to comply with the provisions of this Operating Statement. 6.3.1.2 Utilization Charge for Daily Imbalances. Should an Imbalance as calculated herein exceed +/- 5% of the Gross Nominated Volume on any Day when a Local Gas Flow Order ("LGFO" as described below in Section 12) has not been issued, then LG&E shall charge the Utilization Charge for Daily Imbalances times the Imbalance in Mcf greater than +/- 5% of Gross Nominated Volume for each daily occurrence. The Utilization Charge for Daily Imbalances is included in Exhibit A to this Operating Statement. These charges are in addition to any other charges set forth herein. The Utilization Charge for Daily Imbalances will not be applied to daily Imbalances which do not exceed the +/- 5% unless an LGFO has been issued. If an LGFO has been issued, the Utilization Charge for Daily Imbalances shall apply to daily Imbalances which exceed 0% for customers in violation of the LGFO directive, either "condition (a)" or "condition (b)" as applicable and further described below under "Local Gas Flow Orders" in Section 12. Customers not in violation of the LGFO directive, either "condition (a)" or "condition (b)" as applicable, will continue to be assessed the Utilization Charge for Daily Imbalances on volumes which exceed +/- 5% daily tolerance. LG&E shall not have an obligation to provide balancing service for any volumes of Gas hereunder. 6.3.1.3 Variation in MMBTU Content. The reconciliation of the actual deliveries to the Transportation Delivery Point and LG&E's receipt of Gas from Customer at the Transportation Receipt Point, including any variation in MMBtu content, occurs through the operation of the cash-out provisions in Section 6.3.1.1. If not reflected on the current month's bill, changes in billings of the cash-out provision caused by variations in the MMBtu content of the Gas shall be corrected on the following month's bill using the applicable cash-out price from the month in which the gas was received by LG&E from Customer at the Receipt Point. SECTION 7. Injections and Withdrawals for Storage Services
7.1 Firm Storage Service
7.1.1 Maximum Storage Capacity. Customer's Maximum Storage Capacity shall be set forth in the Service Agreement.
7.1.2 Injections. Customer will be allowed to inject Gas owned by Customer into Storage on each Day in an amount up to Customer's Maximum Daily Injection Quantity ("MDIQ"), as set forth in the Service Agreement, so long as injection of such quantities does not cause Customer to exceed its MSC.
7.1.3 Withdrawals. Customer will be allowed to withdraw Gas owned by Customer from Storage on each Day in an amount up to Customer's Maximum Daily Withdrawal Quantity ("MDWQ"), as set forth in the Service Agreement, so long as withdrawal of such quantities does not cause Customer to incur a negative Working Gas balance.
7.1.4 Authorized Overrun Quantities. If, within the sole judgment of LG&E, operating conditions permit and Customer will neither exceed its Maximum Storage Capacity nor incur a negative Working Gas balance, LG&E may authorize Customer to inject or withdraw quantities in excess of Customer's Maximum Daily Injection or Withdrawal Quantities. Authorized Overrun Quantities shall have the lowest priority of any storage service offered by LG&E.
7.1.5 Base Gas. The amount of Base Gas contribution, if applicable, shall be indicated in the Service Agreement. Customer shall retain title to such Base Gas at all times and shall be entitled to withdraw such contribution of Base Gas, as specified in the Agreement, upon the expiration of Customer's contract term in the event that such contract is not extended or renewed.
7.1.6 Assignment. Subject to LG&E's prior approval and in accordance with any applicable terms in the Service Agreement, firm Storage Service quantities may be assigned from one Customer to another, provided that (i) the Customer taking assignment meets LG&E's credit requirements and has entered into a Service Agreement with LG&E, and (ii) each Customer submits the appropriate nominations to LG&E in accordance with the provisions of Section 8. All applicable charges will be assessed for such transactions, including a title transfer fee, as specified in the Service Agreement.
7.2 Interruptible Storage Service
7.2.1 Establishment of Account. LG&E shall establish an account for each Customer using this service which reflects the Interruptible Storage Balance up to the Maximum Storage Capacity set forth in the Service Agreement. Whenever LG&E receives Interruptible Storage Quantities from, or delivers Interruptible Storage Quantities to, a Customer, LG&E will adjust the Customer's account, as appropriate, to reflect the new balance.
7.2.2 Injections. On an as-available basis, Customer will be allowed to inject Gas owned by Customer into Storage on each Day in an amount up to Customer's Maximum Daily Injection Quantity ("MDIQ"), as set forth in the Service Agreement, so long as injection of such quantities does not cause Customer to exceed its MSC.
7.2.3 Withdrawals. On an as-available basis, Customer will be allowed to withdraw Gas owned by Customer from Storage on each Day in an amount up to Customer's Maximum Daily Withdrawal Quantity ("MDWQ"), as set forth in the Service Agreement, so long as withdrawal of such quantities does not cause Customer to incur a negative Working Gas balance.
7.2.4 Assignment. Subject to LG&E's prior approval and in accordance with any applicable terms in the Service Agreement, interruptible Storage Service quantities may be assigned from one Customer to another, provided that (i) the Customer taking assignment meets LG&E's credit requirements and has entered into a Service Agreement with LG&E, and (ii) each Customer submits the appropriate nominations to LG&E in accordance with the provisions of Section 8. All applicable charges will be assessed for such transactions, including a title transfer fee, as specified in the Service Agreement.
7.2.5 Interruption Notices. In the event that LG&E determines, in its sole judgment, that some or all interruptible Storage Service(s) must be interrupted in order to satisfy LG&E's obligations to firm Customers, or that such interruption is otherwise necessary or is otherwise appropriate to avoid adverse impact on the operation of LG&E's system, LG&E will notify any affected Customer receiving interruptible Storage Service that they are required to reduce their Interruptible Storage Balance(s) over the period specified in the notice. Such notice shall be issued to Customers, via facsimile or email, on a price basis, where lower price services will be noticed before higher price services. At a minimum, Customers will have seven (7) Days in which to comply with the notice. If a Customer fails to comply with the notice, LG&E shall cash out the balance quantity that Customer was advised, but failed to reduce or eliminate, at 90% of the lowest Minimum Daily Gas Index calculated consistent with the notice period.
7.2.6 Low Balance Elimination. LG&E may issue a notice requiring any Customer with an Interruptible Storage Balance of less than 50 Dth to eliminate its existing Interruptible Storage Balance within seven (7) Days. Such notice shall be issued by LG&E to Customer via facsimile or email. If Customer fails to comply with this notice, any positive Interruptible Storage Balance remaining after seven (7) Days will be cashed out at 80% of the lowest Minimum Daily Gas Index calculated during the seven (7) Day period, and any negative Interruptible Storage Balance remaining after seven (7) Days will be cashed out at 120% of highest Maximum Daily Gas Index calculated during the seven (7) Day period.
7.2.7 Contract Termination. Unless a shorter period of time is imposed in a notice issued in accordance with sections 7.2.3 and 7.2.4 above, Customer shall eliminate any outstanding Interruptible Storage Balance within sixty (60) Days of termination of its Interruptible Natural Gas Storage Service Agreement. If Customer fails to eliminate such balance, any positive Interruptible Storage Balance remaining after sixty (60) Days will be cashed out at 80% of lowest Minimum Daily Gas Index calculated during the sixty (60) Day period, and any negative Interruptible Storage Balance remaining after sixty (60) Days will be cashed out at 120% of the highest Maximum Daily Gas Index calculated during the sixty (60) Day period.
SECTION 8. Scheduling and Service Priority
8.1 Firm Storage Service
8.1.1 Storage Receipt and Delivery Points. LG&E and Customer shall designate in the Service Agreement a list of the currently available Storage Receipt and Delivery Points.
8.1.2 Customer Scheduling of Transportation. Customer shall be solely responsible for making all arrangements and paying for the transportation of the Gas to the Storage Receipt Point for injection into Storage, and for making all arrangements and paying for the transportation of Gas from the Storage Delivery Pointfor Gas withdrawn from Storage.
8.1.3 Scheduling of Firm Storage Service and Intra-Day Changes in Nominations. Unless otherwise agreed, all Gas scheduled for a particular Day will be delivered by Customer, or redelivered by LG&E, at a constant rate throughout the day.
8.1.3.1 Customer shall provide LG&E with an initial nomination for injection or withdrawal of Gas for Customer's account or any subsequent modification of such initial nomination, via facsimile, at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance of the third party Transporter's nomination deadline. Nomination information shall conform to the provisions established by Customer's upstream Transporter.
8.1.3.2 Upon confirmation from Customer's upstream Transporter, LG&E will commence injection or withdrawal for Customer's account, subject to the provisions of Section 8.1.3.1.
8.1.3.3 LG&E may waive the twenty-hour (24) hour notice requirement as set forth in Section 8.1.3.1 if, in its sole judgment, operating conditions permit such waiver and the requirements of Section 8.1.3.2 have been fulfilled.
8.1.3.4 Customer shall be responsible for all penalties and charges assessed by an upstream or downstream Transporter which arise from Customer's failure to provide delivery or receive redelivery of the Gas quantities provided pursuant to Section 8.1.3.1.
8.1.3.5 Firm Storage Service will be scheduled prior to interruptible Storage Service under this Operating Statement.
8.2 Interruptible Storage Service
8.2.1 Storage Receipt and Delivery Points. LG&E and Customer shall designate in the Service Agreement, a list of the currently available Storage Receipt and Delivery Points.
8.2.2 Customer Scheduling of Upstream and Downstream Transportation. Customer shall be solely responsible for making all arrangements and paying for the transportation of the Gas to/from the Storage Receipt and Delivery Points.
8.2.3 Scheduling of Interruptible Natural Gas Storage Service. For scheduling purposes, interruptible Storage Service will be subordinate to firm service under this Operating Statement. Unless otherwise agreed, all Gas scheduled for a particular Day will be delivered by Customer, or redelivered by LG&E, at a constant rate throughout the day.
8.2.3.1 Customer shall provide LG&E with an initial nomination for injection or withdrawal of Gas for Customer's account or any subsequent modification of such initial nomination, via facsimile, at least one (1) hour in advance of the third party Transporter's nomination deadline.
8.2.3.2 Upon confirmation from Customer's Transporter, LG&E will commence injection or withdrawal of Gas for Customer's account, subject to the provisions of Section 8.2.3.1.
8.2.3.3 LG&E may waive the one (1) hour requirement as set forth in Section 8.2.3.1 if, in its sole judgment, operating conditions permit such waiver and the requirements of Section 8.2.3.2 have been fulfilled.
8.2.3.4 Customer shall be responsible for all penalties and charges assessed by an upstream or downstream Transporter which arise from Customer's failure to provide delivery or receive redelivery of interruptible Storage Service Quantities provided pursuant to Section 8.2.3.1.
8.3 Local Gas Transportation Service
8.3.1 Transportation Receipt and Delivery Points. LG&E and Customer shall designate in the Local Gas Transportation Service Agreement the Transportation Receipt and Delivery Points. LG&E shall have the discretion to determine the availability of such Transportation Receipt and Delivery Points based on system operations. Under no circumstances will LG&E be required to construct or modify any facilities in order to accommodate Customer's requested Transportation Receipt or Delivery Points.
8.3.2 Customer Scheduling of Transportation to and from LG&E Facilities. Customer shall be solely responsible for making all arrangements and paying for the transportation of the Gas to the designated Transportation Receipt Point, and from the designated Transportation Delivery Point.
8.3.3 Scheduling of Local Gas Transportation Service and Intra-Day Changes in Nominations. Unless otherwise agreed, all Gas scheduled for a particular Day will be delivered at a constant rate throughout the day. The MDQ shall represent the maximum volume which Customer shall be entitled to nominate and LG&E shall be obligated to deliver to the Transportation Delivery Point.
8.3.3.1 Customer shall specify to LG&E the daily volume of Gas to be received by LG&E from Customer at the Transportation Receipt Point ("Gross Nominated Volume").
8.3.3.2 From such Gross Nominated Volume shall be deducted an allowance for LG&E's system average LAUFG expressed as a percentage. Such LAUFG percentage, provided in Exhibit A to this Operating Statement, shall be revised annually each November 1 with notice provided to Customer at least thirty (30) Days prior to such November 1.
8.3.3.3 The Net Nominated Volume (the Gross Nominated Volume less applicable LAUFG) shall be stated in Mcf/day and converted to MMBtu/day using the conversion factor specified by LG&E. The Net Nominated Volume is the amount that shall be delivered to the Transportation Delivery Point. For example, if Customer requests LG&E to receive 342 Mcf on a given Day at the Transportation Receipt Point (the Gross Nominated Volume), and the LAUFG percentage is 5.0%, then the Net Nominated Volume shall be 325 Mcf [342 - (342 x 0.05)]. The Net Nominated Volume of 325 Mcf shall be converted to MMBtu using the conversion factor specified by LG&E.
8.3.3.4 At least ten (10) Days prior to the beginning of each calendar month, Customer shall provide LG&E with a schedule setting forth the daily volumes of Gas to be delivered into LG&E's system for the month. Any changes in daily nominated volumes, as well as any other information required to effectuate the delivery of such Gas to LG&E, shall be provided by Customer to LG&E no later than 10:00 a.m. Eastern Clock Time on the Day prior to the Day(s) for which volumes are scheduled to flow.
8.3.3.5 Only those volumes actually confirmed by LG&E and scheduled at the Transportation Delivery Point are considered Net Nominated Volumes. LG&E shall not be obligated to accept from Customer daily nominations or changes thereto that are made after the daily deadline for such nominations as set forth above or that are made on Saturdays, Sundays, or holidays observed by LG&E.
8.3.3.6 Customer shall submit in writing to LG&E the Gross Nominated Volume and such other information as may be required to effectuate the transportation of Gas by using the appropriate nomination schedule as may be specified by LG&E from time to time and by giving appropriate notice as set forth in the Local Gas Transportation Service Agreement.
8.3.3.7 Customer agrees to inform LG&E of any changes in the delivery rate to LG&E of Gas transported under the Local Gas Transportation Service Agreement or any other information with regard to scheduling of deliveries that LG&E reasonably requests or as may be required by proper regulatory authorities.
8.4 Priority of Service LG&E reserves the right to not offer or commence firm Storage Service or Local Gas Transportation Service, or to discontinue any interruptible Storage Service when, in LG&E's sole judgment, any impairment of its firm services or system operations would or may result. In all instances, firm Storage Service and Local Gas Transportation Service will have a superior priority to interruptible Storage Service, but will have equal priority with the comparable firm storage and transportation service provided to LG&E's retail customers.
8.4.1 In the event that LG&E must restrict firm Storage Service injections, such service will be restricted on a pro rata basis based on each Customer's applicable MDIQ. In the event that LG&E must restrict firm Storage Service withdrawals, such service will be restricted on a pro rata basis based on each Customer's applicable MDWQ. In the event that such action must be taken, LG&E will notify Customers via facsimile or electronic mail.
8.4.2 In the event that LG&E must restrict Local Gas Transportation Service, such service will be restricted on a pro rata basis based on each Customer's applicable MDQ for Local Gas Transportation Service. In the event that such action must be taken, LG&E will notify Customers via facsimile or electronic mail.
8.4.3 Interruptible Storage Service will be restricted based on price, with Customers paying the highest price receiving the highest priority.
8.5 Routine Maintenance LG&E shall have the right to interrupt or discontinue service in whole or in part from time to time to perform routine repair and maintenance on LG&E's system as necessary to maintain the operational capability of LG&E's facilities or to comply with applicable regulatory requirements. LG&E shall exercise due diligence to schedule routine repair and maintenance so as to minimize disruptions of service to Customers and shall provide reasonable advance notice of the same to Customers. In any such disruption, quantities of Gas deliverable under firm Storage Service Agreements and Local Gas Transportation Service Agreements shall take priority over quantities of Gas deliverable by LG&E to Customers under interruptible Storage Service Agreements. Notice of such interruptions or discontinuances shall be issued by LG&E to Customer via facsimile or email. Such interruptions or discontinuances shall in no way serve to alter the obligations of Customer under any applicable Service Agreement.
SECTION 9. Gas Pressure, Quality, and Measurement
9.1 Gas Pressure
9.1.1 Firm or Interruptible Storage Service. LG&E shall redeliver Gas to Customer by displacement at the Storage Delivery Point, provided that offsetting service exists at the same Storage Delivery Point. LG&E shall not be required to adjust its gas system operating pressures in order to effectuate deliveries to the Storage Delivery Point.
9.1.2 Local Gas Transportation Service. It is at all times the responsibility of Customer to deliver Gas to the Transportation Receipt Point at a pressure sufficient to cause the delivery of Gas into the system of LG&E. LG&E shall not be obligated to modify either its facilities or its prevailing system operating pressures in order to effectuate the receipt of Gas from Customer at the Transportation Receipt Point. LG&E shall redeliver Gas to Customer by displacement at the Transportation Delivery Point, so long as offsetting service exists at the same Transportation Delivery Point. LG&E shall not be required to adjust is gas system operating pressures in order to effectuate deliveries to the Transportation Delivery Point.
9.2 Quality
9.2.1 All natural gas received into LG&E's system from Transporter shall meet the applicable quality standards of the respective Transporter delivering natural gas to LG&E.
9.2.2 All natural gas received into LG&E's system from sources other than Transporters shall meet the applicable quality standards prescribed in Section 9.2.7 below.
9.2.3 Gas redelivered by LG&E to or on behalf of the Customer at the designated Transportation or Storage Delivery Point shall conform to the third party Transporter's natural gas quality standards.
9.2.4 Customer agrees that it will indemnify LG&E and save it harmless from all suits, actions, debts, accounts, damages, costs, losses, and expenses arising from or out of any claim by any other persons or entity related to or arising from natural gas tendered by Customer to LG&E not meeting the quality specifications herein.
9.2.5 If the natural gas tendered by Customer fails at any time to conform to any of the specifications or merchantability standards set forth herein, then LG&E shall so notify Customer and LG&E may, at its sole option and in addition to any other remedies available to LG&E, refuse to accept delivery of the gas. Such notification may be the operation of automatic controls that would immediately isolate Customer's facility from LG&E's facilities and shut-in such gas until such time as Customer can provide evidence satisfactory to LG&E that the gas meets the quality specifications and merchantability standards set forth herein. LG&E shall have the right to require Customer to test the quality and/or composition of the gas whether before delivery to LG&E or at any time during the term hereof. LG&E shall determine the gas quality testing requirements, testing frequency, and testing equipment to be employed by both LG&E and Customer. Such testing requirements may be modified by LG&E according to the source or feedstock of Customer's gas. To the extent that the gas received hereunder by LG&E from Customer is derived from one or more sources or feedstocks, Customer shall notify LG&E of the source or feedstock and any changes thereto. When required by LG&E, such gas quality testing performed by either LG&E or Customer shall utilize an independent, certified, third party in order to either determine or confirm the composition and/or quality of the gas being delivered by Customer to LG&E. LG&E shall have the right to witness the collection of gas samples taken by Customer for use in its third-party tests. Customer shall bear the cost of its own testing and reimburse LG&E for the cost of any testing incurred by LG&E. Customer shall provide the results of any testing to LG&E at LG&E's request, and LG&E may audit such results.
9.2.6 LG&E shall have the unqualified right to commingle the natural gas received for service hereunder with natural gas from other sources. Accordingly, the natural gas received by LG&E shall be subject to such changes as may result from such commingling and LG&E shall, notwithstanding any other provisions herein, be under no obligation to deliver for Customer's account natural gas identical to that received by LG&E.
9.2.7 Natural gas delivered by or on behalf of the Customer to LG&E at the Transportation Receipt Point shall be merchantable natural gas, commercially free from toxins, odors, dust, solids, gums, gum-forming constituents, gasoline, water, liquid matter and hydrocarbon liquids which may become separated from the gas in the course of transportation through LG&E's system, or any other foreign substances of any kind (including, for example, carcinogens, siloxanes, volatile metals, heavy metals, halogens or halogenated elements) which might interfere with its merchantability or cause injury to or interference with proper operation of lines, regulators, meters, or other appliances, or which might present health or safety hazards to LG&E employees, contractors, or the general public. Furthermore, such receipts shall not contain, either in the natural gas or in any liquids with the natural gas, any microbiological organism, pathogen, active bacteria, or bacterial agent capable of producing or contributing to corrosion, operational problems, or other problems, or are injurious to utility facilities or cause the natural gas to be unmarketable. Microbiological organisms, bacteria or bacterial agents include, but are not limited to, sulfate reducing bacteria and acid producing bacteria.
