9.3 Measurement
9.3.1 All Gas delivered by Customer to LG&E pursuant to this Operating Statement shall be measured by LG&E using such natural gas meters, chromatograph, and other instrumentation as LG&E deems appropriate. When feasible, LG&E's Gas measurement methodology shall be performed in the same manner as the Customer's third party Transporter's natural gas measurement methodology. In all other instances, LG&E's Gas measurement methodology shall be performed as LG&E deems appropriate and in accordance with LG&E's state-approved tariff.
9.3.2 Any Customer contracting for service hereunder shall be required, prior to commencing service, to have appropriate remote metering devices. The remote metering devices will allow LG&E to monitor receipts of gas from Customer.
9.3.3 Customer shall reimburse LG&E for the cost of this remote metering equipment and the cost of its installation, including any modifications to LG&E facilities required in order to facilitate the functioning of the remote metering. LG&E may also install at Customer's expense, any backflow protection devices, remote flow equipment, and the like, as may be required in LG&E's sole judgment, in order to protect the integrity of LG&E's gas distribution system. Customer shall be responsible for making any necessary modifications to its facilities, including, but not limited to, any modifications of Customer's piping, in order to facilitate the installation and operation of such remote metering or other facilities determined to be necessary by LG&E.
9.3.4 Customer shall be responsible for providing the necessary and adequate electric and telecommunications service to provide this metering within thirty (30) Days of LG&E's notice to Customer that such remote metering shall be required. Electric and telephone services installed for this equipment shall conform to LG&E's specifications. Customer shall be responsible for maintaining the necessary and adequate electric and telecommunications service to provide remote metering.
SECTION 10. Billing and Payment
10.1 Monthly Statement On or before the tenth (10th) Day of each calendar month during the term of this Agreement, LG&E shall render or cause to be rendered a Statement to Customer which sets forth the charges owed by Customer to LG&E for the preceding month's Storage Service or Local Gas Transportation Service. The Statement will set forth (a) the applicable rate(s) for the services performed by LG&E; (b) the quantities being billed at each such rate; and (c) documentation sufficient to support the quantities and dollar amounts shown in the Statement. 10.2 Payment Customer's payment will be due within sixteen (16) Business Days (no less than twenty-two (22) calendar days) from the date of the bill. If the day for payment should fall on a Saturday, Sunday or banking holiday, then such payment shall be made on the next Business Day. 10.3 Billing Adjustments Should Customer fail to pay all of the amount of any correctly determined Statement rendered by LG&E as herein provided when such amount is due, interest on the unpaid portion of the Statement shall accrue from the due date until the date of payment, at the then effective prime interest rate of JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A.or its successor in law, plus one (1) percent. Should, however, Customer present to LG&E reasonable evidence which supports Customer's good faith belief that the amount of such Statement is incorrect, Customer shall pay such amount it believes is correct. Should Customer's position be demonstrated incorrect by LG&E, or found to be incorrect as a result of an arbitration proceeding instituted in accordance with Section 22, Customer shall pay immediately any remaining amount owed with interest calculated from the date of receipt of LG&E's original Statement at the then effective prime rate of JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A.or its successor in law. 10.4 Termination for Non-payment of Statements Nothing in this Section 10 shall be deemed to prevent LG&E from terminating service to a Customer for non-payment of the undisputed amounts of any invoices rendered hereunder, in accordance with the provisions of Section 15. 10.5 Audit Rights Each of Customer and LG&E shall have the right, at its sole expense and during normal business hours, to audit the accounts and records of the other Party to the extent necessary to verify the quantities and charges made or demanded pursuant hereto. Neither Party shall have the right to perform more than two (2) such audits per year. Such right to audit shall be available for the term of any Service Agreement and for two (2) years after its termination. If it shall be found at any time within two (2) years of the date of a Statement that there has been an overcharge or undercharge or an incorrect payment in any form whatsoever under the provisions hereof, including as a result of an arbitration proceeding instituted in accordance with Section 22, and Customer shall have actually paid the Statement containing such overcharge or undercharge, then within thirty (30) Days after the final determination thereof, the Parties shall refund the amount of any such overcharge or remit any undercharge. Settlement of any such overcharge or undercharge shall include interest from the date the error is identified in writing at the then effective prime interest rate of JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A.or its successor in law. SECTION 11. Taxes
Customer agrees to reimburse LG&E within fifteen (15) Days of invoice for all taxes, including any applicable energy, value added, sales or use tax, franchise fee or tax, or taxes similar in nature, or equivalent in effect, attributable to the injection, storage, withdrawal, or transportation of Customer's Gas, or payments made by LG&E pursuant to the Service Agreement. Any such reimbursement shall be at the applicable rate prescribed by law. If Customer is exempt from the obligation to pay such taxes, Customer shall provide LG&E with documentation establishing that exemption. Customer's Kentucky Sales Tax Permit Account Number shall be provided to LG&E pursuant to LG&E's request.
SECTION 12. Local Gas Flow Order
12.1 LG&E shall have the right to issue an LGFO which will require actions by Local Gas Transportation Service Customer(s) to alleviate conditions that, in the sole judgment of LG&E, jeopardize the operational integrity of LG&E's system. Local Gas Transportation Service Customer(s) shall be responsible for complying with the directives contained in the LGFO.
12.2 Notice of an LGFO shall be provided to Local Gas Transportation Service Customer at least four (4) hours prior to the beginning of the Day for which the LGFO is in effect and shall include information related to the LGFO. A shorter notice period may be given where necessary to protect the integrity of LG&E's natural gas system. Local Gas Transportation Service Customer shall respond to an LGFO by adjusting its deliveries to LG&E's system as directed in the LGFO within the specified timeframe.
12.3 Upon issuance of an LGFO, LG&E will direct Local Gas Transportation Service Customer to comply with one of the following conditions: (a) Local Gas Transportation Service Customer must nominate at the Transportation Receipt Point a Gross Nominated Volume that is no more than the daily amount being received by LG&E from Local Gas Transportation Service Customer at the Transportation Receipt Point("Metered Receipts"); or (b) Local Gas Transportation Service Customer must nominate at the Transportation Receipt Point a Gross Nominated Volume that is no less than the Metered Receipts.
12.3.1 Local Gas Transportation Service Customer shall respond to an LGFO either by adjusting its Gross Nominated Volume at the Transportation Receipt Point or by adjusting volumes being received by LG&E from Customer at the Transportation Receipt Point.
12.3.2 All volumes nominated by Local Gas Transportation Service Customer at the Transportation Receipt Point in excess of volumes received by LG&E from Local Gas Transportation Service Customer at the Transportation Receipt Point in violation of the above "condition (a)" LGFO shall constitute an unauthorized under-delivery by Local Gas Transportation Service Customer to LG&E at the Transportation Receipt Point. All volumes nominated by Local Gas Transportation Service Customer at the Transportation Receipt Point less than volumes received by LG&E from Local Gas Transportation Service Customer at the Transportation Receipt Point in violation of the above "condition (b)" LGFO shall constitute an unauthorized over-delivery from Local Gas Transportation Service Customer to LG&E at the Transportation Receipt Point.
12.3.3 Unauthorized under-deliveries or over-deliveries during the effectiveness of an LGFO shall be subject to an LGFO Charge per Mcf for each Mcf of unauthorized under-deliveries or over-deliveries, as applicable. Local Gas Transportation Service Customer shall be subject to the LGFO Charge on the Day for which the LGFO was violated, plus any other charges under this Operating Statement, including any applicable Utilization Charge for Daily Imbalances, for such unauthorized under-deliveries or over-deliveries that occur. The current LGFO Charge is reflected in Exhibit A to this Operating Statement.
12.4 LG&E may, in its sole judgment, issue an LGFO to an individual Local Gas Transportation Service Customer taking service under this Operating Statement without issuing an LGFO to all Local Gas Transportation Service Customers taking service under this Operating Statement.
12.5 LG&E will not be required to provide service under this Operating Statement if Local Gas Transportation Service Customer does not comply with the terms or conditions of an LGFO. Payment of LGFO Charges hereunder shall not be considered an exclusive remedy for failure to comply with the LGFO, nor shall the payment of such charges be considered a substitute for any other remedy available to LG&E. As a result of Local Gas Transportation Service Customer's failure to comply with the terms or conditions of service, including an LGFO, LG&E may take such actions as it deems necessary to suspend service to Local Gas Transportation Service Customer.
12.6 If Local Gas Transportation Service Customer fails to manage its use of LG&E's Local Gas Transportation Service in strict conformance with the directives of an LGFO, then LG&E may in its sole judgment do one or more of the following immediately upon delivering oral or written notice to Local Gas Transportation Service Customer: (1) suspend all Local Gas Transportation Service to the extent necessary to protect the operational integrity of LG&E's system, (2) decline to deliver to the extent necessary the Gas provided by Local Gas Transportation Service Customer, (3) decline to receive to the extent necessary the volume of Gas tendered by Customer at the Transportation Receipt Point, and (4) permanently terminate service under this Operating Statement. Any suspension or termination under this section shall be without prejudice to and in addition to any other rights and remedies of LG&E.
SECTION 13. Force Majeure
Neither of the Parties hereto shall be liable in damages to the other if rendered unable, by reason of an event of Force Majeure, to perform, in whole or in part, any obligation (other than Customer's obligation to make payment of any amounts due and payable to LG&E) set forth in this Operating Statement. The term Force Majeure as used herein shall mean: any causes or circumstances not due to the fault of the Party claiming Force Majeure beyond such Party's reasonable control, including acts of God, strikes, lockouts, acts of the public enemy, wars, blockades, insurrections, riots, epidemics, landslides, lightning, earthquakes, fires, storms, floods, washouts, arrests and restraints of rulers and peoples, civil disturbances, explosions, breakage or accident to machinery or pipelines, interruptions or failures of any upstream or downstream pipelines relied upon to effectuate any service under this Operating Statement, the binding order of any court or governmental authority having jurisdiction, and any other cause, whether of the kind herein enumerated or otherwise, not reasonably within the control of the Party claiming suspension and which by the exercise of due diligence such Party is unable to prevent or overcome. Failure to prevent or settle any strike or strikes shall not be considered to be a matter within the control of the Party claiming suspension and shall be entirely within the discretion of the Party affected, and the requirement that any event of Force Majeure be remedied with all reasonable dispatch shall not require the settlement of strikes or lockouts by acceding to the demands of those directly or indirectly involved in such strikes or lockouts when such course is inadvisable in the discretion of the Party having such difficulty.
Upon the occurrence of an event of Force Majeure, the Party affected shall give notice to the other Party including the particulars of the event as soon as practicable, by telephone followed by written confirmation. Customer's obligation to pay all amounts that are due as well as all amounts that become due during a Force Majeure event experienced by Customer shall not be affected by such Force Majeure, regardless of its duration. For each day that LG&E is unable to provide Storage or Local Gas Transportation Service due to a Force Majeure event ("LG&E Force Majuere Event"), Customer shall remain liable for all amounts due as well as all amounts that become due under its Service Agreement(s) during the first ten (10) days of the LG&E Force Majeure Event. Following such ten (10) day period, Customer's payment oblitations under the Service Agreement(s) shall be suspended for the remainder of such LG&E Force Majeure Event.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, in no event will Customer's payment obligations be suspended as contemplated under this Section 13 if:
(1) Customer fails to properly schedule Storage and/or Local Gas Transportation Service in accordance with Section 8 of this Operating Statement or otherwise fails to comply with its obligations under this Operating Statement; or
(2) LG&E's failure to provide Storage or Local Gas Transportation Service is due to the action or inaction of Customer or due to the modification or expansion of existing LG&E or Customer facilities at the request of Customer and that are designed, in whole or in part, to provide enhanced or additional service to Customer.
SECTION 14. Title and Risk of Loss
14.1 Title Each Customer warrants that it has good title to all Gas delivered to LG&E for storage and/or transportation, as applicable, and that such Gas will be free and clear of all liens, encumbrances, and claims whatsoever, and that it will indemnify LG&E and save it harmless from all suits, actions, debts, accounts, damages, costs, losses, and expenses (including attorney's fees) arising from or out of adverse claims of any and all persons to said Gas.
14.2 Responsibility of Gas for Storage Service As between Customer and LG&E, Customer shall be deemed to be in control and possession of the Gas prior to delivery to LG&E for injection at the Storage Receipt Point and after redelivery at the Storage Delivery Point, and Customer shall indemnify and hold LG&E harmless from any damage or injury caused thereby. LG&E shall be deemed to be in control and possession of the Gas after the delivery of the same for injection at the Storage Receipt Point and until redelivery by LG&E to Customer at the Storage Delivery Point, and LG&E shall indemnify and hold Customer harmless from any damage or injury caused thereby, except for damages and injuries caused by the sole negligence of Customer. The risk of loss for all Gas injected into, stored in and withdrawn from storage shall remain with Customer, and LG&E shall not be liable to Customer for any loss of Gas, except as may be occasioned due to the intentional or grossly negligent acts or omissions of LG&E. Any losses of Gas, unless due to the intentional or grossly negligent acts or omissions of LG&E, shall be shared proportionately by all Customers.
14.3 Responsibility of Gas for Local Gas Transportation Service With regard to Local Gas Transportation Service, Customer shall be in exclusive control and possession of the Gas until such Gas has been delivered to LG&E at the Transportation Receipt Point and after such Gas has been delivered to the Transportation Delivery Point. LG&E shall be in exclusive control and possession of such Gas while it is in LG&E's system between the Transportation Receipt Point and the Transportation Delivery Point. LG&E shall have no liability while the Gas is in the exclusive control of Customer and Customer shall have no liability (except for damage, loss, or injury caused by LG&E's transportation of natural gas that does not meet the quality standards set forth herein or that is delivered to LG&E in violation of any other provision of this Operating Statement) while the Gas is in the exclusive control of LG&E. Title to all Gas delivered by Customer to LG&E for transportation under this Operating Statement shall remain with Customer at all times during transportation by LG&E. LG&E shall not acquire or take title to the Gas transported hereunder with the exception of any over-deliveries purchased through the operation of the cash-out mechanism described hereunder.
SECTION 15. Default
15.1 Termination for Default If (i) either Party shall fail in any material respect to comply with, observe, perform, or shall default in any material respect upon any obligation under the Agreement, except due to causes excused by Force Majeure or attributable to the other's wrongful act or failure to act, and such failure materially and adversely affects the ability of either Party to deliver or accept Gas and (ii) after written notice thereof from the Party claiming a right to terminate the Agreement, such failure shall continue for a period of thirty (30) Days, then the Party claiming the right to terminate may, by notice in writing, terminate the Agreement as of the date of the notice of termination; provided, however, that if such failure cannot be reasonably cured within such thirty (30) Days, the Party claimed to be in default shall be entitled to such further time as shall reasonably be required to effect such cure, provided that such Party commences within such thirty (30) Days substantial efforts to effect such cure and at all times thereafter proceeds diligently to complete such cure.
15.2 Other Rights Preserved The availability or exercise of the right to terminate an Agreement pursuant to this Section shall not serve to diminish or effect the right of the Parties to seek damages or specific performance, for breach of the Agreement, as provided in the Agreement.
SECTION 16. Assignment
Any Agreement hereunder shall be binding upon, shall inure to the benefit of, and may be performed by, the successors and permitted assigns of the Parties, except that Customer shall not assign any of its rights or obligations under an Agreement without the prior written consent of LG&E. No assignment, pledge, or other transfer of the Agreement shall operate to release the assignor, pledgor, or transferor from any of its obligations under the Agreement unless consent to the release is given in writing by the other Party or such transfer is incident to a merger or consolidation with, or transfer of all or substantially all of the assets of the transferor to, another person or business entity which shall, as part of such succession, assume all the obligations of the transferor under the Agreement.
SECTION 17. Notice
Any notice, demand, offer or other written instrument required or permitted to be given pursuant to the Agreement, except for those provisions in this Operating Statement requiring otherwise, shall be in writing signed by the Party giving such notice and shall be hand delivered or sent by registered letter, overnight courier provided a receipt signed by the addressee is obtained to the other Party. Unless otherwise specifically provided in the Agreement, any written notice or other communication shall be sufficiently given or shall be deemed given on the third Business Day following the date on which the same is mailed by registered or certified mail, postage prepaid, addressed:
(a) if delivered to LG&E:
Louisville Gas and Electric Company P.O. Box 32020 Louisville, Kentucky 40232 Attn: Pamela L. Jaynes, Director - Gas Management, Planning and Supply Telephone: (502) 627-2339 Facsimile: (502) 627-3584 pam.jaynes@lge-ku.com ACH Transfer Information: Attn: Acct #__________ ABA #___________
(b) if delivered to Customer: As set forth in the Service Agreement
Each Party shall have the right to change the place to which notice shall be sent or delivered by similar notice or like manner to the other Party. The effective date of notice issued pursuant to this Agreement shall be the earlier of the date of addressee's receipt of such notice or the third Business Day following the date on which the same is mailed by registered or certified mail, postage prepaid.
SECTION 18. Modifications of the Operating Statement
From time to time it may become necessary to update or revise this Operating Statement. LG&E shall have the right to propose, file, and make effective with FERC, revisions to this Operating Statement for the purpose of changing the provisions thereof effective as to the Customer, except that LG&E shall have no right to alter the rates or charges for Storage Services or Local Gas Transportation Services rendered pursuant to a Service Agreement, except such alterations to the rates or charges that are specifically permitted pursuant to a Service Agreement. The filing of such applicable changes and revisions to this Operating Statement shall be without prejudice to the right of the Customer to contest or oppose the effectiveness of such filing.
SECTION 19. No Consequential Damages
IN NO EVENT SHALL LG&E OR CUSTOMER BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER FOR CONSEQUENTIAL, INDIRECT, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF SERVICE PROVIDED UNDER THIS OPERATING STATEMENT.
SECTION 20. Regulatory Requirements
Any and all Storage and Local Gas Transportation Services under this Operating Statement must be interstate services eligible under, and shall be fully subject to, the applicable requirements of Section 284.224 of FERC's rules and regulations, as they may be revised from time to time.
SECTION 21. Miscellaneous Provisions
21.1 The Operating Statement and applicable Service Agreement(s) between the Parties set forth the entire integrated agreement of the Parties hereto with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all other agreements, written or oral, relating to the subject matter hereof. In the event of a conflicting term in this Operating Statement and applicable Service Agreement, the terms of the Service Agreement shall prevail.
21.2 A waiver by either Party of any one or more defaults by the other in the performance of any provisions of an Agreement shall not operate as a waiver of any future default or defaults, whether of a like or different character.
21.3 Any amendment, change, modification, or alteration of a Service Agreement shall be in writing and signed by both Parties to such Service Agreement.
21.4 Any provision of an Agreement held to be unenforceable in any jurisdiction shall be, as to that jurisdiction only, ineffective only to the extent of such unenforceability, without affecting any other provision of the Agreement.
21.5 The captions and headings in this Operating Statement and in any Service Agreement are inserted for convenience of reference only and shall not affect the construction or interpretation of the Operating Statement or the Service Agreement.
21.6 There are no third party beneficiaries of any Agreement between the Parties, and the provisions of any Agreement do not impart enforceable rights to anyone who is not a Party.
21.7 THIS OPERATING STATEMENT AND ALL SERVICE AGREEMENTS EXECUTED HEREUNDER SHALL BE GOVERNED BY THE LAWS OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY, WITHOUT REGARD TO PRINCIPLES OF CONFLICTS OF LAWS.
21.8 The terms of any particular Service Agreement shall be kept confidential by the Parties, except for any required disclosure to a regulatory body, governmental entity, or agency having jurisdiction. In case of such disclosure, the disclosing Party shall attempt to obtain an appropriate protective order or enter into an appropriate protective agreement.
Section 22. Binding Arbitration
22.1 Controversies to be Resolved by Binding Arbitration Any controversy or claim arising out of or relating to a Service Agreement, or the breach thereof, shall be settled by binding arbitration in accordance with the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association, and judgment upon the award rendered by the arbitrators may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.
22.2 Selection of Arbitrators The controversy will be submitted to a panel of three arbitrators as follows. Within fifteen (15) Business Days after the demand for arbitration has been served, Customer and LG&E each shall select an arbitrator of its own choosing and notify the other Party of the name of the arbitrator such Party has selected. Within ten (10) Business Days of their selection, the two arbitrators so selected shall jointly choose a third arbitrator. If any Party shall fail to select any arbitrator, or if the two selected arbitrators shall fail jointly to select a third arbitrator within the time periods set forth herein, then any Party may apply to the American Arbitration Association for an appointment of such arbitrator.
22.3 Qualifications of Arbitrators The arbitrators selected to act shall be qualified by education, experience, and training to pass on the particular controversies in dispute, including having expertise in the natural gas industry and being knowledgeable about the marketing and pricing of the natural gas commodity. The arbitrators selected shall be fair and impartial, and shall have no financial interest in the outcome of the matter to be decided, or in either of the Parties.
22.4 Applicable Law In resolving any controversy or claim arising under this Agreement, the arbitrators shall apply the laws of the Commonwealth of Kentucky without resort to the laws of Kentucky regarding conflicts of law. The arbitrators shall permit discovery in accordance with the Kentucky Rules of Civil Procedure. Each Party shall bear its own cost of arbitration, and shall share equally the costs of the arbitrators.
22.5 Scheduling of Hearing Arbitration shall take place at a single hearing before the arbitrators. The arbitrators shall select the time and place for the hearing promptly after his or their appointment, provided that the time scheduled for the hearing shall not be later than ninety (90) Business Days after the date of the appointment of the last arbitrator appointed. The arbitrators shall give written notice of the scheduled hearing to each Party at least ten (10) Business Days prior to the date so fixed.
22.6 Hearing Procedure At the hearing, each of the Parties shall submit its position, together with such testimony and evidence as each Party may see fit, with respect to the controversy at issue. Such testimony or evidence may be oral or written. After the hearing, each Party shall have the right to submit such written summary of its own submissions and positions as it deems appropriate, and written comments upon the submissions and positions of the other Party. The arbitrators shall affix an appropriate timetable for such written comments and submissions. Said arbitrators shall hear and determine the matters presented for decision; shall consider all testimony, evidence, submissions, and comments provided, giving such weight to each as the arbitrators may deem appropriate; and shall render a decision thereon by selecting either the Customer's or LG&E's position in the dispute no later than thirty (30) Days after the date affixed for written comments and submissions. The arbitrators must confine their decision to a selection of one of the positions of the Parties. They shall have no authority to fashion a compromise or alternative position.
22.7 Arbitrators' Decision The decision of the arbitrators shall be in writing, and shall be final and binding on the Parties, except in the event of fraud or failure of an arbitrator to disclose a relevant interest. The arbitrators shall cause a copy of the decision to be delivered to each of the Parties, and judgment upon the award rendered by the arbitrators may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.

STATEMENT OF RATES
Storage Services

Daily Demand Charge: $0.1442 per Mcf Daily Storage Charge: $0.3797 Utilization Charge for Daily Imbalances: $0.5239 per Mcf
LAUFG: 1.48%
